name: Legion of Super Heroes: Blok Quiz | Legion of Super-Heroes | 10 Questions

questions.text: Introduced in 'Superboy and the Legion of Super Heroes' #253 (1979), what is Blok's real name?
questions.explanation:
Blok.

	Blok is one of only three members from the Legion's original continuity that did not employ a code name (the other two being Princess Projectra and Dawnstar).

Dryad.

	When humanoids colonized Dryad, they eventually discovered the planet was inhabited by silicon (rock like) beings that were native to the planet.  The two species lived harmoniously for hundreds of years.

questions.text: When the Legion first met Blok, he was a member of another team of superpowered beings.  What team did he belong to?
questions.explanation:
The League of Super-Assassins.

	Blok, along with five carbon based humanoids from Dryad, had been convinced by the Dark Man that the Legion was responsible for the destruction of Dryad, and they set out to take revenge.

questions.text: The Legion attempted to relocate residents of Bloc's home planet before it was destroyed due to an unstable core.  Only the carbon based beings left.  What happened to the silicon-based residents?
questions.correct: They opted to go into their dormant states
options: They opted to relocate to the same world as the human residents
They opted to relocate to a world separate from the humanoids
questions.explanation:
They opted to go into their dormant states.

	The native Dryad silicon based beings, other than Blok, opted to enter their dormant state, to be sent off into space.  They would "revive" once they encountered worlds that were capable of sustaining their type of life.

questions.text: During Blok's early Legion career he was injured very badly on two different occasions.  Each one resulting in an alteration to his physical appearance.  What were the two most prominent alterations?
questions.correct: He lost his collar and his nose
options: His coloring changed and he lost digits on his hands
He developed outer ears and lost his feet
His hair fell out and pointed shards appeared on his shoulders
questions.explanation:
He lost his collar and his nose.

	While battling Darkseid during the "Great Darkness Saga" he lost the ridged "collar" that had extended below his neck.  Later, while battling Omen, his injuries resulted in his body becoming pock-marked and his face loosing features, including his entire nose.

questions.text: Blok had difficulty fitting in and adjusting to life in the Legion. He developed a particular hobby/pass-time to assist him with his acclimation.  What what it?
questions.correct: He spent large amounts of time researching the Legion's archives
options: He spent his spare time going to group meetings at the Legion Academy
He became the trainer for the Legion of Super Pets
He would sneak into his teammate's quarters and go through their belongings
questions.explanation:
He spent large amounts of time researching the Legion's archives.

	Blok spent so much time researching the past adventures of the Legion, and their recorded archives, and the backgrounds of his fellow Legionnaires that he was pretty much considered the unofficial Legion historian.

questions.text: Until a personalized flight right could be produced by for him, because of his massive density, Blok originally required how many standard flight rings to get him airborne?
questions.explanation:
Three.

	Flight rings are given to all Legion of Super Heroes members. Many of them would need to be personalized.  Sun Boy's had to withstand his heat, Polar Boy's had to withstand his sub-zero powers, and Phantom Girl's needs to turn immaterial with her.

questions.text: Blok eventually develops romantic feelings for one of this fellow Legion members.  Which one?
questions.explanation:
White Witch.

	Blok's two closest friends in the Legion are Timber Wolf and the White Witch.  With the Witch, he originally was more a "big brother", but later developed romantic feelings for her.

questions.text: In the Legion's "Five Year Later" continuity, Blok resigned from the Legion and went off to the Puppet Planetoid to contemplate his existence.  He was hunted down and murdered by whom?
questions.explanation:
Roxxas.

	Roxxas was contracted by the Dominators to kill former Legion members to dissuade the reformation of the team.  Roxxas killed Blok and it serves to do just the opposite.  The Legion was reborn.

questions.text: In the Legion's "retroboot" continuity, after being fatally wounded again, Blok leaves the Legion to reside with his romantic soulmate.  Where do they reside?
questions.explanation:
Zerox.

	The White Witch assumes the throne of the Sorcerer's World, Zerox. After admitting her love for Bloc, he is healed and his form altered to a smooth exterior.  He chooses to stay and be her consort and guardian.
